Hello Folks,

I am trying to unit test my code that is to be deployed in a Weblogic
container. I have been able to seperate most functional code from the
EJB code and am able to unit test most of the code. However, some of
my tests still throw errors simply because i am running these tests
outside of the weblogic's JVM. Is there a way to get into a running
JVM (weblogic in my case) and load junit classes and my classes in
that container's JVM?

Thanks in advance for all your attention.

Yours,
Eagle
